etymology.description: Depicts a cowrie shell, used as currency in ancient China -> cowry shell
etymology.interpretation: The character 贝(貝) (bèi, 'cowry shell') visually represents a cowrie, which was used as a form of currency. This pictographic representation makes it easily recognizable.
etymology.simplification: The simplified form 贝(貝) is essentially a cursive shorthand of the traditional 貝, retaining the same visual representation but with fewer strokes.

examples.chinese: 在海滩上发现贝(在海灘上發現貝)，带来好运(帶來好運)。
examples.pinyin: Zài hǎitān shàng fāxiàn bèi, dài lái hǎoyùn.
examples.english: Finding a cowry shell on the beach brings good luck.

examples.chinese: 古人用贝交换物品(古人用貝交換物品)。
examples.english: Ancient people exchanged cowry shells for goods.

examples.chinese: 博物馆里陈列着各种贝(博物館裡陳列著各種貝)，展示古人的生活(展示古人的生活)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn lǐ chénliè zhe gè zhǒng bèi, zhǎnshì gǔrén de shēnghuó.
examples.english: Various cowry shells are exhibited in the museum, showcasing the life of ancient people.
